summary.p: 20 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 36; Qurʾānic Text: Q 7:30-7:77; 7 lines per page; Dimensions: 232 x 162mm; Script style: kūfī D.I.
The fragment Arabe 355 (a) (BNF) belongs to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 36
20 fol. 162×232 mm (1.43). Support: thin and transparent parchment of yellowish color, with traces of polishing. Writing material: brown ink.
Collation: two quires, in both outer, inner and the middle sheets are bifolia, the rest are singletons with a stub.
I: H1F H2F S H3F H4F S H5F / F6H F7H S F8H F9H S F10H;
II: H11F H12F S H13F H14F S H15F / F16H F17H S F18H F19H S F20H;

Text layout: 70×140 mm (2.0), 7 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: →D I. Diacritics: random mixture of the older diacritics (large round red and green dots) and the newer one (smaller colored dots). Vocalization: large round red and green dots.

Verse markers: for individual verses – rosettes in gold and colors (type 3.1.2); for groups of five verses – medallions in the text line or on the margins in gold and colors (type 1.A.I) with the inscribed word خمس ; for groups of ten verses – medallions in the text line (type 2.A.II?) in gold and colors with the inscribed numbers of verses (ثلثون – fol. 2r, اربعون – fol. 6r, خمسون – fol. 10v, ستون – fol. 14v, سبعون – fol. 18r).
Inscriptions: all the sheets have marks in pencil with the surah numbers in Roman numerals and verse numbers in Arabic numerals.
Stitching: threads are preserved in the punctures of the fold; on the outer folds of quires there are traces of brown substance (glue and leather?).
Defects: stains and traces of moisture, especially on fol. 13; lower margins damaged; ink peeling off on the flesh sides of the sheets.

Attached materials: old wrapping (fol. I) consisting of a narrow strip of paper inscribed with letters “C.H.”, brief description of the manuscript in French in brown ink – “20 f. 7 lig. \\ S. VII. v. 28 a 75” and old accession number in red pencil “B 14”.
Old accession numbers: С.Н. (on the wrapping); B. 14 (on the wrapping and according to Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r–20v. Surah 7, verses 28(30)–75(77). Incipit: [فريقًا] حَقَّ عليهم . Explicit: الناقةً و[عتوا عن أمر ربّهم] .
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Arabe 355a (BNF)."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
